column4: is it safe to install something via apt-get while a package manager is downloading something, and would it appear in the pckage manager? Basically do all package managers use the same database
but if i close the package manager and do the apt-get would opening the package manager show it as installed and let me do the regular stuff with it?
i guess it will then?
guess i'll try myself :)
!pastebin
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/28480/ 'nuff said
dabaR:
Quote: ""Linux/debian installation. apt-get install python pygame"
except i already have python so ijust did apt-get install pygame
before i compile, is there any other way to get pygame?
pygame is in the repositories
did you do 'sudo apt-get update' ?
no, i guess i'll do that ;)
build-essential is included on the cd
on the alternate install cd? and does it include kernel-headers too?
yes, it should include both of those
and er, how would i go about installing it from there? >.>
in synaptic, you can go to the edit menu and there should be an option to add the cd as a repository.  I think if you just pop in the cd, it should actually just prompt you to add it as a repository
and i use synaptic on a system with no gui... how?
then use apt-cdrom
right, ok, thanks
